creator: jcorley@togethersoft.com
text:
I would like the input task to be able to not echo the inputted data to stdout
when requested.  If I want to gather passwords (CVS pserver for example) before
beginning a build task, it will echo my password to stdout.  Using command line
options to ant isn't a clean solution, since I'd only like to suppress this
output at certain points.  Here's an example:

get.password:
    [input] Please enter password for jason
jason'sPassword

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
I've been playing with executing "stty" on Unix from within a Java program,
but it didn't have any effect.  Does anybody know how one can read from System.in
without echo?

creator: umagesh@apache.org
text:
Going native is currently the _recommended_ option, for now.  But there are 
_crude_ workarounds that one can use (by having a thread print out a backspace 
character to stdout, I think).

OK, writing to System.out is not possible as Ant hides the "real" System.out
from the tasks (or from other parts like the input proposal).

For the same reason sending some strange ANSI codes won't work as they need
to get through through Ant's logging system first (well, one could append them
to the prompt, maybe).

Any other ideas?  Otherwise I'd mark this as LATER in the sense of "I'd love to
fix it, I just don't know how".
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
I'm closing this as non fixable using stdio, pending sun ever releasing a
version of java that supports the relevant 'better console IO' RFE.
Realistically the P(fix(sun,RFE(consoleIO))==0, given all the other priority
issues like 'add web services to j2ee'. 

The only alternate is to provide an AWT prompt for input; someone adds this (And
writes a test for it!) then we can have fun.
creator: stevel@apache.org
hauser@acm.org
text:
I guess this would have the form of an optional boolean attribute 
(named "password")?

Or this attribute could have more than just two permitted values if the user 
also could choose between "suppress" and "replace characters with asterisks".

---
Just for curiosity, as I didn't fully get Steve's comment:
Has there been a 'better console IO' RFE placed with Sun or not?
And if so, is it accessible via an URL that could be posted here?

or could http://www.gnu.org/software/classpath/ eventually make the solution of
this independent of Sun?
creator: hauser@acm.org

text:
Not likely. It is GPL, which conflicts with Apache Licensing and can't be added
to the project. (This is a long standing policy decision/interpretation). I see
they have a special exception for "linked executables" but if you wish to
discuss the meaning of this exception you should probably do it in a thread on
the dev list before adding more comments here.

Before posting there you probably should read past discussions at 

http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=ant-dev&r=1&w=2

Also see http://ant.apache.org/ant_task_guidelines.html

Especially the section on Licensing and Copyright.
creator: gus.heck@olin.edu
stevel@apache.org
text:
Relevant Java RFE is bug # 4050345,
http://developer.java.sun.com/developer/bugParade/bugs/4050435.html

date of filing: May 1997. 
Implicit priority from Sun: very low indeed.

We could still do with a gui InputHandler; Ant1.6 could even go to swing :)

creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
Thx for the link - I voted for it and encourage everybody to do so as well!!!

At least it makes #17 out of their top 25 RFEs and appears to be the only one
concerning security. If all readers here vote for it, it may get even more
attention!

P.S.: There are only 5 bugs at Sun with more votes than this RFE - again none of
them as clearly related to security as this one!

creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
Two partial work-arounds:

Wayne's password-task: http://homepage.ntlworld.com/wayne_grant/ant.html

And if you have to automate a task requiring password, a way to at least not to
have to share the password in the CVS by means of the checked-in build.xml --->
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20208

Bruce Schneier's http://sourceforge.net/projects/passwordsafe could be a great
tool to interface with in a custom ant task in order to solve the "password
problem" - see 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=772245&group_id=41019&atid=429582
creator: hauser@acm.org
bodewig@apache.org
text: Note that passwordsafe is a Windows native C++ solution.
